meanings.definition: A brief promotional description or review of a book, movie, or other product.
meanings.sent1: The blurbing on the back cover of the book caught my attention.
meanings.sent2: I always read the blurbing on movie posters before deciding to watch a film.
meanings.sent3: The author's attempt at blurbing their own book was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The blurbing for the new product was so enticing, I had to buy it.
meanings.sent5: Her talent for blurbing made her the go-to person for promotional writing.

meanings.definition: The act of writing or providing a blurb.
meanings.sent1: She was praised for her blurbing skills at the publishing company.
meanings.sent2: Blurbing requires creativity and a good understanding of the product.
meanings.sent3: His passion for blurbing was evident in every blurb he wrote.
meanings.sent4: The art of blurbing is like painting a picture with words.
meanings.sent5: Blurbing can make or break the success of a book or movie.

meanings.definition: To write or provide a blurb for a product.
meanings.sent1: I will be blurbing the new book release next week.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys blurbing for different products to help them sell.
meanings.sent3: He spent hours blurbing the latest movie, trying to capture its essence.
meanings.sent4: Blurbing the new restaurant menu felt like describing a delicious adventure.
meanings.sent5: She blurbs with such enthusiasm that readers can't help but be intrigued.
